content: In the last week 29 Iraqis have been killed and 68 wounded in 29 bombing, and a number of shooting incidents. 13 unidentified bodies have been found. 2 US soldiers were reported dead in relation to OIF. The coalition air forces flew a total 139 tacair missions over Iraq. In related news Iranian shelling and Turkish bombing of Kurds have continued. President Talibani, along with announcing his retirement, indicated there would be no 'independence' for Iraq's Kurds. An uptick in attacks in general and a number of attacks on the oil industry have been noted as 'concerning'. Rocket and mortar attacks on Coalition forces installations and the Green Zone have occurred again this week.

The coalition air forces flew a total 139 tacair missions over Iraq. In related news Iranian shelling and Turkish bombing of Kurds have continued. President Talibani, along with announcing his retirement, indicated there would be no 'independence' for Iraq's Kurds. An uptick in attacks in general and a number of attacks on the oil industry have been noted as 'concerning'. Rocket and mortar attacks on Coalition forces installations and the Green Zone have occurred again this week.
title: Iraq Update

content: This past week in Iraq 70 Iraqis died. and 111 were injured in more than 27 bombing and shooting incidents. 4 dumped bodies were found and 67 'militants' were reported arrested. 2 US personnel wre reported to have died. The USAF reported 96 TacAir sorties over Iraq. It also reported that 26 bombs had been dropped on Iraq in 767 sorties in April. Oil attacks continued with the demolition of 2 main pipelines near Kirkkuk. Blackwater, and Australia wrapped up their Iraq operations last week. It was also reported the Iraq government had resumed its schedule of judicial executions after an 18 month hiatus, with 12 hangings on Sunday. The St. Augustine Record reports this story of a grenade-throwing incident. >http://www.staugustine.com/stories/051009/world_051009_053.shtml Whether the 12 year-old was killed justifiably or in error remains unclear. But what is this? "When the shooting was over and the patrol went away, I stood and I saw Omar on the ground covered with blood," Jassim said." The patrol, after firing on a reported three people, drove off and left a dead kid in the street? Must have been in 'fear for their lives', again. But they did manage to stick around to count the dinars in the dead boy's hand???

content: And Canada has the highest reported rates of marijuana use in the western world... you had a point?
